themedAreas.name: Germany
themedAreas.description: The entrance area of the park, serving as the gateway to all the European countries. This section showcases traditional German architecture with half-timbered buildings, cobblestone streets, and a charming town square. The Germania clock tower stands prominently in the central square, offering a perfect meeting point for visitors. The area celebrates German culture, craftsmanship, and folklore, with beautiful flower displays and an authentic atmosphere that immediately transports visitors to a quintessential German town.

attractions.name: EP-Express

themedAreas.name: Italy
themedAreas.description: A romantic recreation of Renaissance Italy featuring beautiful piazzas, fountains, and Mediterranean architecture. Visitors can stroll through a charming Italian village filled with cypress trees, elegant colonnades, and a replica of the famous Trevi Fountain. The area captures the essence of Italy with its warm color palette, artistic details, and vibrant atmosphere. Ornate facades and decorative elements make this one of the most picturesque sections of the park, especially beautiful as the sun sets and the lighting creates a magical evening ambiance.

attractions.name: Castello dei Medici

attractions.name: Piccolo Mondo

attractions.name: Teatro di Roma

dining.name: Pizzeria La Romantica

dining.name: Gelateria

dining.name: Taverna
dining.description: Fast casual Italian fare including paninis, pasta, and tiramisu.

shopping.name: La Bottega

shopping.name: Vetreria

themedAreas.name: France
themedAreas.description: An elegant homage to French culture featuring a beautiful Parisian boulevard lined with authentic French façades, stylish lampposts, and charming cafés with outdoor seating. The centerpiece is a scaled replica of the Moulin Rouge, complete with its iconic red windmill and dazzling lights. This area offers a blend of French architectural styles from different periods, from Parisian grandeur to provincial charm. Flower beds, topiary gardens, and fountains add to the sophisticated atmosphere, while the sounds of accordion music and the scent of fresh pastries complete the immersive French experience.

attractions.name: Silver Star

attractions.name: Madame Freudenreich Curiosités

attractions.name: Bellevue Ferris Wheel

attractions.name: Eden Palais

dining.name: Le Bistro

dining.name: Café de Paris

dining.name: La Côte d'Azur

shopping.name: Boutique Française

themedAreas.name: England
themedAreas.description: A charming recreation of London and the English countryside, featuring iconic British elements like red telephone booths, double-decker buses, and Tudor-style architecture. The area includes a miniature version of Shakespeare's Globe Theatre, a traditional English garden with manicured hedges, and a vibrant London square. The attention to detail extends to authentic street signs, Victorian lampposts, and even a replica of Big Ben. The atmosphere shifts between the bustling energy of London and the quaint tranquility of a rural English village, complete with a duck pond and cottage gardens.

attractions.name: Arena of Football - Be Part of It

attractions.name: London Bus

attractions.name: Globe Theatre

dining.name: London Street Food

themedAreas.name: Spain
themedAreas.description: A vibrant celebration of Spanish culture featuring a picturesque plaza with a central fountain surrounded by colorful Mediterranean buildings with ornate ironwork balconies and terracotta rooftops. The area captures the essence of different Spanish regions, from Andalusian courtyards with mosaic details to historic castles reminiscent of medieval Spain. Olive trees and flowering bougainvillea add to the Mediterranean atmosphere, while the sounds of flamenco music and the aroma of Spanish cuisine enhance the immersive experience. At night, the warm lighting creates a particularly magical ambiance in this lively and colorful section of the park.

themedAreas.name: Russia
themedAreas.description: An impressive representation of Russian architecture and culture featuring the iconic onion domes and colorful spires reminiscent of Saint Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. The area combines elements of imperial Russia with space-age designs, reflecting both the country's historic grandeur and its achievements in space exploration. The centerpiece is a set of four mirrored towers housing the Euro-Mir spinning coaster, representing the former Soviet Mir space station. Surrounding buildings showcase detailed facades with intricate patterns and vibrant colors typical of Russian architecture. This area is particularly spectacular in winter, when snow adds to the authentic Russian atmosphere.

themedAreas.name: Greece
themedAreas.description: A stunning recreation of ancient Greece with pristine white buildings, azure blue domes, and classical columns creating a Mediterranean paradise. The area is designed to evoke both the ancient grandeur of classical Greek architecture and the idyllic island atmosphere of places like Santorini. Temple ruins, statues of Greek gods, and amphitheaters showcase the ancient heritage, while bougainvillea-covered buildings and seaside tavernas capture the charm of modern Greek islands. The Poseidon water coaster serves as the centerpiece, with its impressive Greek temple facade visible from multiple areas of the park. The attention to detail extends to authentic Greek music, the scent of Mediterranean herbs, and the sparkle of the 'Aegean Sea' water features.

themedAreas.name: Portugal
themedAreas.description: A colorful tribute to Portugal's rich maritime history and Mediterranean charm. This area recreates a Portuguese coastal town with traditional buildings featuring detailed azulejo tile work, wrought iron balconies, and vibrant façades in yellows, blues, and terracottas. Maritime elements dominate the theme, with sailing ships, navigation instruments, and tributes to famous Portuguese explorers like Vasco da Gama and Ferdinand Magellan. Palm trees, citrus plants, and flowering vines add to the coastal Mediterranean atmosphere. The centerpiece is the Atlantica SuperSplash attraction, which represents Portugal's historic connection to the sea and the Age of Discovery, when Portuguese navigators mapped much of the world's oceans.

themedAreas.name: Netherlands (Holland)
themedAreas.description: A picture-perfect recreation of the Netherlands featuring iconic Dutch elements like windmills, tulip gardens, canals with small bridges, and traditional gabled houses painted in distinctive colors. The charming Dutch village atmosphere is enhanced with flower markets, wooden clogs displayed in shop windows, and cheese stalls. The Pirates in Batavia attraction reflects the Netherlands' colonial history and the Dutch East India Company's presence in what is now Indonesia. The area is particularly spectacular during spring when thousands of tulips bloom in carefully designed patterns, creating a vibrant rainbow of colors. The detail extends to working windmills that actually harness wind power, authentic canal boats, and traditional Dutch music playing throughout the area.

themedAreas.name: Switzerland
themedAreas.description: A picturesque Alpine wonderland that captures the essence of the Swiss mountains complete with snow-capped peaks, traditional chalets with flower-adorned balconies, and the sound of cowbells in the distance. The area features cobblestone streets lined with authentic Swiss architecture, including detailed woodwork and painted murals on building facades. Visitors can experience Swiss hospitality while enjoying views of miniature Alpine landscapes with working cable cars, waterfalls, and mountain goats. The Swiss precision and attention to detail are evident throughout this area, from the clocktowers to the intricate music boxes playing traditional melodies.

themedAreas.name: Scandinavia
themedAreas.description: A Nordic wonderland that combines elements from Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Denmark into a cohesive Scandinavian experience. The area features weathered wooden buildings with dragon-head decorations reminiscent of traditional Norse architecture, stave churches, and Viking longhouses. Dense pine forests, crystal-clear lakes, and rocky formations create the impression of a fjord landscape. The Fjord-Rafting attraction forms the centerpiece, surrounded by Nordic mythology references including rune stones, trolls hiding among the rocks, and nods to Norse gods like Thor and Odin. During winter, this area becomes especially magical with snow-covered landscapes and Northern Lights effects.

themedAreas.name: Austria
themedAreas.description: An immersive recreation of the Austrian Alps and Vienna's imperial splendor, combining rustic Tyrolean charm with the elegance of Habsburg-era architecture. The area features Alpine chalets with intricately carved wooden balconies, colorful flower boxes, and traditional frescoes alongside stately buildings reminiscent of the Schönbrunn Palace and Vienna's grand boulevards. Visitors can explore both mountain village atmospheres and sophisticated Viennese café culture. The Vienna Wave Swing stands as a beautiful centerpiece with its ornate Art Nouveau design, while the Tirol Log Flume offers a journey through Austrian mountain scenery. During the winter season, this area transforms into a magical Alpine Christmas setting with traditional decorations and holiday activities.

themedAreas.name: Iceland
themedAreas.description: A dramatic landscape that captures Iceland's unique geology and mythology, featuring volcanic rock formations, geysers, hot springs, and glacial elements. This newer section of the park combines the raw beauty of Icelandic nature with Nordic folklore and mythical elements. The centerpiece attractions Blue Fire Megacoaster and Wodan Timburcoaster represent the dynamic forces of fire and ice central to Icelandic mythology. Runic inscriptions, mystical creatures, and references to Nordic gods add depth to the theming. Whale Adventures and Snorri Touren connect to Iceland's maritime heritage and folklore. The area is designed with sustainable practices in mind, reflecting Iceland's commitment to environmental protection, including energy-efficient lighting that creates an ethereal glow reminiscent of the Northern Lights at night.

themedAreas.name: Ireland - Children's World
themedAreas.description: A whimsical Irish-themed area specifically designed for younger guests, combining the magic of Irish folklore with child-friendly attractions and activities. Lush green landscapes, rainbow motifs, leprechaun houses, and Celtic designs create an enchanting environment where children can explore safely. The area features smaller-scale replicas of traditional Irish cottages, castle ruins, and fairy gardens with interactive elements throughout. Shamrocks, pots of gold, and lucky symbols are incorporated into the colorful design, while gentle music featuring Irish flutes and fiddles enhances the magical atmosphere. This section provides the perfect blend of entertainment and rest areas for families with small children, with plenty of shade, seating, and amenities designed with parents' needs in mind.

themedAreas.name: Adventure Land
themedAreas.description: An exciting themed area dedicated to exploration, discovery, and adventure from around the world. Unlike the country-specific areas, Adventure Land combines elements from different global exploration eras – from ancient archaeological expeditions to jungle adventures and modern-day thrill-seeking. The area features weathered expedition buildings, jungle vegetation, archaeological dig sites, suspension bridges, waterfalls, and mysterious caves. Dense foliage, ambient jungle sounds, and themed props like explorer vehicles, crates, and expedition equipment enhance the immersive environment. This section offers a mix of thrilling attractions and interactive experiences that appeal to visitors seeking excitement and a sense of discovery, with hidden details and Easter eggs throughout for observant explorers to find.

attractions.name: Euro-Tower
attractions.description: A 75-meter tall observation tower with a slowly rotating platform that provides 360° panoramic views of the entire park and surrounding Black Forest region.

attractions.name: Jungle Rafts
attractions.description: A gentle boat journey through exotic landscapes with wildlife animatronics and explorer camps.

attractions.name: Adventure Maze
attractions.description: A challenging maze with puzzles, interactive elements, and hidden treasures to discover.

attractions.name: Canyon Coaster
attractions.description: A moderate thrill coaster that takes riders through rocky canyons and cave formations.

dining.name: Explorer's Club
dining.description: Global cuisine inspired by explorer journeys, served in a restaurant decorated with maps, artifacts, and expedition memorabilia.

dining.name: Bamboe Baai
dining.description: Asian specialties including noodle dishes, stir-fries, and exotic fruits in a tropical bamboo setting.

dining.name: Jungle Juice Bar
dining.description: Fresh fruit smoothies, coconut water, and exotic non-alcoholic beverages.

shopping.name: Adventure Outfitters
shopping.description: Adventure-themed clothing, explorer hats, binoculars, compasses, and other expedition equipment.

shopping.name: Global Treasures
shopping.description: Collectibles and souvenirs inspired by world travel and exploration.

funFacts: The area contains over 200 hidden expedition artifacts for guests to discover
Many plants in this area are exotic species maintained in special climate-controlled environments
The rockwork was hand-carved by artisans to mimic natural formations from around the world

themedAreas.name: Grimm's Enchanted Forest
themedAreas.description: A magical realm that brings to life the beloved fairy tales of the Brothers Grimm, immersing visitors in the enchanting world of classic German folklore. This whimsical area features a dense, atmospheric forest with twisted trees, mushroom cottages, and winding paths that lead to various fairy tale scenes. Storybook facades house attractions based on tales like Hansel and Gretel, Snow White, Sleeping Beauty, and Rapunzel. The architecture intentionally features exaggerated proportions and perspectives that make adults feel as though they've shrunk to child-size, enhancing the magical experience. Ambient sounds of forest creatures, magical music, and occasional character appearances create a truly immersive fairy tale environment that appeals to visitors of all ages while honoring Germany's rich literary heritage.

attractions.name: Sleeping Beauty's Castle
attractions.description: A beautifully detailed castle where visitors can explore rooms from the famous fairy tale, including the spinning wheel room and enchanted rose garden.

attractions.name: Hansel & Gretel's Adventure
attractions.description: A gentle dark ride through the famous story, including the candy house and witch's cottage.

attractions.name: Rapunzel's Tower
attractions.description: A play tower with slides and climbing elements themed around Rapunzel's famous home.

attractions.name: Cinderella Carousel
attractions.description: A beautifully decorated carousel featuring characters and scenes from Cinderella.

dining.name: Witch's Kitchen
dining.description: Hearty German fare served in a slightly spooky yet child-friendly setting inspired by the witch's house from Hansel and Gretel (without being too frightening).

dining.name: Fairy Tale Treats
dining.description: Cookies, candies, and treats inspired by German fairy tales, including gingerbread houses and 'poison' apple treats.

dining.name: Grandmother's Cottage
dining.description: Coffee, tea, and traditional German cakes served in a cozy cottage setting reminiscent of Little Red Riding Hood's grandmother's house.

shopping.name: Storybook Store
shopping.description: Books, illustrated tales, and literary souvenirs related to the Brothers Grimm and other fairy tale authors.

shopping.name: Magic Mirror
shopping.description: Fairy tale character merchandise, costumes, and themed souvenirs.

events: Nighttime light shows illuminating the enchanted forest
funFacts: The area contains references to over 25 different Grimm fairy tales
Many of the trees have faces carved into them that 'watch' visitors as they pass by
The Grimm brothers were born near this region of Germany, making this a tribute to local literary heritage

themedAreas.name: Kingdom of the Minimoys
themedAreas.description: A fantastical area based on Luc Besson's 'Arthur and the Minimoys' film series that creates the illusion of being shrunk down to the size of the tiny Minimoy people. This immersive environment features massive grass blades, enormous flowers, and gigantic insects that tower over visitors, creating a convincing 'miniaturized' perspective. The detailed theming includes mushroom buildings, bioluminescent plants, and intricate Minimoy architecture with natural elements like bark, leaves, and stones incorporated into structures. Special lighting effects create a magical atmosphere, especially as daylight fades, with glowing plants and creatures bringing the microscopic world to life. This highly immersive area succeeds in making visitors feel they've truly entered the fantastical movie universe, with props and scenes directly inspired by the films.

attractions.name: Arthur
attractions.description: An indoor/outdoor family coaster that takes riders on an adventure through the miniature world of the Minimoys, with elaborate themed environments both inside and outside.

attractions.name: Mül's Carousel
attractions.description: A themed carousel featuring creatures and characters from the Minimoy world.

attractions.name: Poppy's Playground
attractions.description: A playground designed to look like insects and plants from the miniaturized Minimoy world, where children can climb, slide, and explore.

attractions.name: Minimoy Village
attractions.description: An immersive walk-through experience where guests can explore the tiny village and interact with animated elements.

dining.name: Jack's Feast
dining.description: Family-friendly cuisine served in an environment designed to look like the dining hall from the Minimoy kingdom, with oversized utensils and food-shaped decor.

dining.name: Nectar Bar
dining.description: Fresh fruit drinks, smoothies, and natural treats themed as the 'nectar' that Minimoys consume in the films.

dining.name: Honeydrop Café
dining.description: Simple meals and snacks served in a setting designed to look like a honeycomb with 'honey' dripping from the ceiling.

shopping.name: Minimoy Market
shopping.description: Merchandise featuring Arthur and the Minimoy characters, including toys, apparel, and collectibles from the films.

shopping.name: Tiny Treasures
shopping.description: Unique gifts inspired by the miniature world, including glow-in-the-dark items and jewelry.

events: Character appearances by Arthur, Selenia, and other Minimoy characters
Special light shows after dark highlighting the bioluminescent elements
Interactive scavenger hunts through the Minimoy village
funFacts: The area features the largest artificial plants in any European theme park
Special forced perspective techniques make regular-sized elements appear gigantic
The Arthur attraction was the first ride of its kind when it opened in 2014

themedAreas.name: Croatia
themedAreas.description: One of the newest themed areas in Europa-Park, showcasing the beauty and culture of Croatia through Mediterranean coastal architecture, ancient stone structures, and lush vegetation typical of the Adriatic region. This section features whitewashed buildings with terracotta roofs, stone arches, and colorful flower displays reminiscent of Dubrovnik and other Croatian coastal towns. Olive trees, lavender, and grape vines add to the authentic Mediterranean atmosphere. The area celebrates Croatia's mixture of natural beauty, rich history, and technological innovation, with the Voltron Nevera coaster (named after Croatia's electric hypercar manufacturer Rimac) serving as the perfect blend of traditional Croatian heritage and forward-thinking technology. Water features evoke the famous Croatian coastline, while decorative elements showcase traditional crafts and cultural symbols.

attractions.name: Voltron Nevera - Powered by Rimac
attractions.description: A high-tech launched coaster inspired by the Croatian electric hypercar manufacturer Rimac, featuring multiple acceleration points and futuristic theming.

attractions.name: Adriatic Wave Rider
attractions.description: A splash attraction simulating the waves of the Adriatic Sea with interactive water elements.

attractions.name: Dalmatian Carousel
attractions.description: A carousel featuring animals and marine life found along the Croatian coast.

attractions.name: Croatian Heritage Museum
attractions.description: A small exhibit showcasing Croatian culture, history, and technological innovations.

dining.name: Konoba
dining.description: Traditional Croatian dishes including seafood, grilled meats, and Dalmatian specialties in a setting reminiscent of a coastal tavern.

dining.name: Rimac Café
dining.description: Cutting-edge cuisine and drinks in a sleek, modern setting that reflects Croatia's innovation economy.

dining.name: Adriatic Wine Bar
dining.description: Croatian wines, olive oils, truffles, and small plates featuring ingredients from different Croatian regions.

shopping.name: Croatian Artisans
shopping.description: Traditional Croatian handicrafts, lavender products, olive oil, and artisanal souvenirs.

shopping.name: Voltron Shop
shopping.description: Tech-themed souvenirs related to the Voltron Nevera coaster and Rimac hypercars.

events: Croatian folk music and dance performances
funFacts: The Voltron Nevera coaster is named after the Rimac Nevera, one of the world's fastest electric hypercars
Real Croatian stone was used in constructing parts of this area for authenticity
As Europa-Park's newest country addition, Croatia represents the park's commitment to showcasing more diverse European cultures

themedAreas.name: Luxemburg
themedAreas.description: A charming representation of one of Europe's smallest countries, serving as a transitional area that connects several other European themed sections of the park. The area captures Luxembourg's unique position as a cultural crossroads, blending French, German, and Belgian influences. Featuring traditional architecture with steep-pitched roofs, timber framing, and flower boxes, this quaint section recreates the feel of Luxembourg's picturesque small towns and countryside. While smaller than other country areas, it offers exquisite attention to detail with wrought-iron signs, cobblestone pathways, and lush greenery reflective of the verdant Luxembourg landscape.

attractions.name: Luxembourg Miniatures
attractions.description: A detailed miniature village showcasing Luxembourg's most famous landmarks and castles in perfect scale.

attractions.name: Grand Ducal Carousel
attractions.description: A small, elegant carousel featuring scenes from Luxembourg's history and folklore.

dining.name: Café Grand-Ducal
dining.description: Traditional Luxembourg pastries, coffee, and light meals including quiche, reuben, judd mat gaardebounen (smoked pork with broad beans), and kachkéis (cooked cheese).

dining.name: Wine Terrace
dining.description: Selection of wines from Luxembourg's Moselle region with cheese and charcuterie boards.

shopping.name: Luxembourg Treasures
shopping.description: Fine goods reflecting Luxembourg's craftsmanship including crystal, porcelain, and handcrafted items.

funFacts: This area subtly incorporates elements from all three official languages of Luxembourg: French, German, and Luxembourgish
The design incorporates Luxembourg's national motto 'Mir wëlle bleiwe wat mir sinn' (We want to remain what we are)
Though small, this area serves as an important hub connecting multiple country sections, reflecting Luxembourg's central position in Europe
